div.div: Σμινθεύς , voc. Σμινθεῦ: Smintheus, epith. of Apollo, explained by ancient commentators as meaning destroyer of field-mice (σμίνθοι). (The cut, showing a mouse at work, is reproduced from the tetradrachm of Metapontum.)
From A Homeric Dictionary (Georg Autenrieth, New York, Harper and Brothers, 1891)
